importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article reflects the current state of food supply conditions in Gaza following the US-brokered ceasefire, highlighting ongoing humanitarian challenges.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The current time frame indicates the immediate post-ceasefire humanitarian situation in Gaza, where food supplies remain critically low despite temporary improvements.

keyTakeAways: Food supplies to Gaza remain far below the WFP's daily target of 2,000 tonnes, with only 750 metric tonnes entering daily.
Only two Israeli-controlled crossings—Karem Abu Salem and al-Karara—are currently operational, severely limiting aid delivery.
The WFP has 26 food distribution points open in Gaza, up from five, but still far short of the 145 it aims to operate across the territory.
Humanitarian aid is reaching northern Gaza through southern routes, but large-scale convoys to Gaza City and the north are absent.
The WFP has not been granted access to the Salah al-Din Street, a major north-south route, blocking critical aid access.
Hamas has pledged to hand over the bodies of 28 captives; 13 have been delivered, with two more reported exhumed on 2025-10-21.
The US-brokered ceasefire and Donald Trump’s 20-point peace plan are central to enabling sustained humanitarian access.
Residents are storing food due to fears that the ceasefire may end or that aid could be cut off again.
The current food supply is sufficient for only half a million people for two weeks, indicating acute food insecurity.

namedEntities.name: WFP
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: The United Nations World Food Programme
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The WFP is the primary agency responsible for monitoring and delivering food aid to Gaza, and its statements on supply levels highlight the severity of the humanitarian crisis.

namedEntities.name: Gaza
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian territory under Israeli control
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the central location of the food supply crisis, where humanitarian access is restricted and population suffering is most acute.

namedEntities.name: Karem Abu Salem
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing into Gaza from Israel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: One of the only two operational crossings into Gaza, it is critical for food delivery and has been used for humanitarian aid entry.

namedEntities.name: al-Karara (Kerem Shalom)
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing into Gaza from Israel
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The second operational crossing, al-Karara (Kerem Shalom in Israel), is vital for the flow of food supplies into Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Salah al-Din Street
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A major north-south road in Gaza
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This key transportation corridor has been blocked to humanitarian operations, restricting access to northern Gaza and worsening food insecurity.

namedEntities.name: Hamas
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian political and militant organization
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Hamas is involved in the prisoner exchange agreement and has agreed to return captured Israeli bodies, which is a condition for reopening some crossings and easing the humanitarian crisis.

namedEntities.name: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netanyahu has declared that the Rafah crossing remains closed until Hamas delivers the remains of deceased captives, directly impacting aid access.

namedEntities.name: US President Donald Trump
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Former US President who brokered the ceasefire
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Trump's 20-point peace plan is foundational to the current ceasefire and the promise of full humanitarian aid delivery into Gaza.

namedEntities.name: Qassam Brigades
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Qassam Brigades announced the exhumation and handover of two Israeli captives’ bodies, fulfilling part of the prisoner exchange agreement.

namedEntities.name: Rafah border crossing
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A border crossing between Gaza and Egypt
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This crossing is currently closed by Israel, and its reopening is contingent on Hamas delivering the bodies of Israeli captives, limiting humanitarian access to Gaza's southern region.

summaryOfNewsArticle: The UN World Food Programme reports that food supplies to Gaza remain critically insufficient, with only 750 metric tonnes of aid entering daily—far below the target of 2,000 tonnes—due to only two Israeli-controlled border crossings being operational. The WFP has expanded distribution points to 26, but still falls short of the 145 planned. Humanitarian access is severely restricted, including the denial of access to the Salah al-Din Street, and aid to the northern regions remains minimal. While Hamas has committed to returning the bodies of 28 captives, only 13 have been delivered, with two more reported exhumed on 2025-10-21. The ceasefire brokered by US President Donald Trump is seen as vital for sustaining aid, and residents are storing food due to fears of renewed conflict or supply disruption.
title: WFP says food supplies to Gaza below targets, urges more crossings to open
